intro: Andrewsia paniculata, commonly known as the panicled andrewsia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its clustered inflorescences, which consist of small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a rough texture, while the stems are often hairy. Andrewsia paniculata is often found in open woodland or grassland habitats.
